results.title: Right first time
results.brief_description: The introduction of modern methods of quality control to meet specifications of an important customer, and eventually reduce overall costs. Quality control concerns every stage of production - market research, raw materials, production engineering, manufacture packaging, distribution, and customer reaction.

results.title: Right and left hand values
results.creator_credit: Dave Bell, Dave Bell Associates and Media Fiver
results.brief_description: Introduces teachers to new theories about the right and left hemisphere of the brain. In an in-service workshop Dr Bob Samples, author of ‘The Metaphoric Mind’, contrasts and compares the rational mind and the metaphysocal mind. He concentrates on the brain-hemisphere functions as related to values and morals as well as the similarities between prjudices and values. Bob also discusses Piaget’s theory and his research and experience in Hopi Indian communities. Photographed by Wayne Threm.

results.title: Rig 20
results.brief_description: Shows the battle which was waged for five weeks against a fire which broke out in an oil well in Persia. The film includes a remarkable shot of an explosion followed by the upward rush of half-a-mile of steel pipe, and the resulting column of inflammable gas which was finally brought under control. Won a first prize at Venice, 1952. Photographed by Martyn Wilson.

results.title: Riding your bicycle
results.brief_description: Outlines safe bicycle riding practices for the 7-12 age group. Firm safety rules are established and demonstrated, stressing the need for continual alertness, consideration for other road users and obedience to road rules and signs.

results.title: Rideau Canal: reflections
results.brief_description: From its source in a narrow valley alongside the Parliament buildings in Ottawa, the Rideau Canal winds through the heart of the city and beyond, to its summit at Upper Rideau Lake. Following the Cataraqui River system, vessels descend at Kingston on the St Lawrence River. Peaceful communities that were established along the Rideau by the first travellers still reflect the lifestyles of the area’s original settlers. A hive of boating and camping activity in summer, a brilliant profusion of colour in spring and autumn, a 200km skating rink in winter, the Rideau Canal offers delights to historians, antique collectors, photographers, artists and sightseers.

results.title: Rick Stein's seafood lovers guide
results.brief_description: Renowned chef Rick Stein takes a languid journey along the coastline of the United Kingdom in search of the best seafood places to eat and where to get the best produce when cooking fish yourself. Rick cooks an assortment of dishes using mackerel, Portland squid, dover sole, gurnard, herring, wolffish, haddock, mussels, smokies, Penclawdd oysters, monkfish, Mount’s Bay pilchards, abalone. He also calls in on the Blessing of the nets in Brighton, the Dieppe Street Market, Pilchard Press Works plus numerous other venues. Beautiful photography and delicious dishes make this a gastronomic as well as a armchair traveller’s delight.

results.title: Rick -File X258375
results.creator_credit: National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.) and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how the probation service responds to a youthful narcotics offender who - unbeknownst to the people coming into contact with him - is a probation employee himself. This film shows Rick assuming the role of ‘offender” and going through the same interview process as actual offender would go through.

results.title: Riches of the Veldt: South Africa
results.creator_credit: Bill Colleran, Louis De Rochemont and United World Films
results.brief_description: This film opens with a glimpse of the natives in their villages. These villages furnish native labour for the farms, cities and mines of the country. We are shown glimpses of Johannesburg, which lies on a plateau and developed out of the extensive gold-mining operations in that region. A visit to a mining engineer and his family living in the suburbs indicates that their traditions derive from the Dutch and English who constituted the original white population. There are views of the large cattle ranches on the veldt, the orange groves, and, in the south, grape country. The processes of gold mining and the demand mines at Kimberly are shown. The film closes with views of Captetown, the seaport.
